definitions.title: n.pr.gent.
definitions.body: the Moschi (Gk.Mosxoi, v. infr.; As. Mušku, Muški, Dl:Par 250 E. Schr:COT Ge 10:2; KGF 155 ff.; cf. Sab. [[משך]] Hal:243);—‘son’ of Japheth Ge 10:2 (P), between [[תֻּבָל]] and [[תִּירָס]], = 1Ch 1:5; also, [[מֶָשֶׁךְ]], prob. err., v:1Ch 1:17 (v. [[מַשׁ]]); [[מֶָשֶׁךְ]] Ps 120:5 (‖[[קֵדָר]]; here without [[תֻּבָל]]); ´[[תּוּבַל וּמ]] Ez Eze 27:13 cf. Eze 32:26, Eze 38:2 (both + [[תֻּבָל]]); so also LXX Is 66:19 (Lo Sta:Javan 8 Du Che:Hpt; v. supr. [[מָשַׁח]]

); [[וְתֻבָָל]] ´[[גּוֹג נְשִׂיא ראׁשׁ מ]] Ez Eze 38:3, Eze 39:1. LXX Mosox (Mesox), Sam. [[ך]]([[י]])[[מושׁ]].—On identif. cf. Boch.; in Assyr. times they dwelt in W. (or NW.) Armenia (cf. Schr:l. c.); in Pers. times appar. farther NE. (SE. of Euxine Sea), cf. Mosxoi kai\ Tibarhnoi Herod:iii. 94; vii. 78; also Di:Ge 10:2 and Che:Encycl. Blb. Art. Geogr. (Biblical).
